data.text: @saracress Its mediocre,Mam.Moderna caused rashes to a 72 yr old woman and (I believe) killed a 56yr old doctor!?
@saracress Day of 2nd dose: no problem! A little arm soreness.  Day after: felt like a quick head cold. Over in about 4 hours.
@lonestarCLP You must give it up for the immune system.

@saracress I only had a sore arm the first round. I would say the majority of people I know experience the icky side effects the second round, but for a short duration and I kept reminding myself it meant my immune system was awesome.
@lonestarCLP Hmm! I don’t really have a reaction to my annual flu shot. But the first covid shot did make me pretty tired for a couple of days, which is why I assume this will be more intense.

@saracress For what it’s worth: I reacted exactly how I react to the flu shot and every other vaccine I can remember receiving (Gardasil in college for HPV.) If you have a standard reaction as I do, I’d bet it’s along those lines.

@saracress Minor headache two hours after shot. Next am: fever (never run fevers), body aches, tired, chills, headache. Advil every 4-5 hours kept everything but body aches at bay. I could WFH (no way in an office). Lasted 24 hours and back to 100%.
@saracress Just got it this afternoon. Mostly just tired so far. Arm is WAY less sore than shot 1, hopefully a good sign. Started on Tylenol from the jump, just in case. Will see tomorrow.
@alphacatpower The range of side effects is kind of astonishing.
@saracress I recently had Shingrix, it’s supposed to be worse. I just slept a lot.
@kerriclark My husband is making chili and I got Fritos and cheese, so I hope Frito pies will be a good sub.

@saracress I had my 2nd Pfizer on Wed . Ran a fever, the worst headache I’ve ever had and couldn’t stop shivering. Friday feeling exhausted but ok. But maybe Moderna is different. Also only one in family who reacted this way. Everyone else was fine. Go figure
Today I went to the store and bought pizza rolls, ice cream and cupcakes. One of those should be able to soothe me in my shiver-y hour, or I can throw myself a child's birthday party.
@saracress I was cold, literally 96 degrees.  My coworkers ran the gambit-fever was most common
@saracress Sluggish 6 hours after, fever and achy for 24 hours, much better after that.
@saracress Don’t sweat it too much, just rest, drink lots of water and take it easy. Your arm may hurt/be tender a day or two after. Ibuprofen should help if you need it.

@saracress My fiancé had his 2nd shot recently and it actually wasn’t as bad as the first was for him, as far as how he felt afterwards. Mostly body/muscle aches and pain. When you have chronic illnesses though you tend to have a stronger reaction to any shot/illness than a healthy person.
@kateshellnutt @saracress I heard that too. That the strong reactions to the second dose is a positive sign from your body's immune system. 😃 https://t.co/hPMylafQcs

@natehankz @saracress A doctor friend said younger people with severe reactions may just have extra-vigilant immune systems and to take it as a sign that your defense against the virus will be strong.
@saracress Take a tylenol pm at bedtime.

@saracress I’m getting my second on Sunday. Someone at work got it Wednesday and felt fine until yesterday and then had to call in sick for the past two days. Anticipating having to do a lot of resting and hydrating
@saracress Ah, this is the link I was looking for https://t.co/75vecR7HSB
@dev1tx Good to know! Thanks.
@saracress https://t.co/LnccTjWVk7

@saracress Tylenol! Handled most of my flu-like symptoms, and luckily I never ran a fever (most I know did, though). 

And rest. The fatigue lasted three days for me.
@saracress Take Ibuprofen before your second shot and be prepared for side effects such as being tired, fever, chills and/or muscle soreness. Good Luck!
@saracress For me, Advil PM, warm socks, tea, and Uber Eats comfort food (Lubys). It wasn’t terrible, but it wasn’t great! And the crappy feeling only lasted a day.
@RestellyQuist I haven't had a fever in years. I don't even know what I might want on hand to make myself feel better.
@saracress Only anecdotal, but I've heard to expect 36 hours of soreness and general malaise. It should match the weather anyway.
@saracress I was out of work for 2 days with fever. Felt generally achy and crappy, like I had Covid again. My arm was incredibly sore.
@KRyanoutloud Yikes! Ok.
@KRyanoutloud Interesting!
@KRyanoutloud How high did your fever get?

@saracress Arm was more sore than after the first shot. Had some fatigue and body aches the next day and a mild fever for a few hours. 2 colleagues had no side effects but most have been similar to mine. 🙏👍
